title: Quota System
body:
We introduced a policy-driven quota system with real-time enforcement (see [datum-cloud/milo#322](https://github.com/datum-cloud/milo/pull/322)) into Milo that supports controlling the amount of resources that can be claimed by consumers. Admins can also grant consumers additional resources as needed. Read more about the [quota system's API in Milo's API documentation](https://github.com/datum-cloud/milo/blob/main/docs/api/quota.md).

An example of using Milo's quota system is available in [datum-cloud/datum#79](https://github.com/datum-cloud/datum/pull/79) where we are using it to control the number of projects that can be created by organizations based on whether the organization is a personal org or a standard org.

Learn more and see the history over on [enhancement #77](https://github.com/datum-cloud/enhancements/issues/77#issuecomment-3608921721)

title: Controlled Onboarding and Waitlists
body:
To support the launch of Datum Cloud, we needed a waitlist feature to control early access and then initiate onboarding for select users. We designed a simple feature to help us out. Hereâ€™s how it works:

- End users can sign up for a waitlist tied to the authentication method of their choosing (GitHub or Google). This streamlines the onboarding experience once approved. 
- Platform admins can grant permission to specific users, triggering an email notice.  
- Alternatively, admins can send personalized invitations to contacts who have not yet requested access via the waitlist. This allows friends and family to skip the line. 

Check out the work history on GitHub [Issue #372](https://github.com/datum-cloud/enhancements/issues/372)

title: Contact & list management
body:
Milo now supports the ability to create & manage contacts in groups fit for specific needs like marketing campaigns or operational notifications. 

Key features: 

- Create contact resources with basic fields (name, email address, status) 
- Create and manage public or private lists with the ability to add or remove contacts
- Store preferences and consent per contact with traceable timestamps 

Check out the work history on Github [Issue #193](https://github.com/datum-cloud/enhancements/issues/193)
